docs.title: Welcome to Pluggedspace Documentation
docs.text: Pluggedspace is a unified platform offering smart SaaS tools designed for startups, agencies, and enterprise teams. This documentation provides everything you need to get started with our ecosystem, use our APIs, and integrate our services into your workflows.

docs.title: 🔍 Overview
docs.text:
Pluggedspace powers a suite of intelligent, scalable tools, including:

  • Monica — AI-powered customer service assistant.
  • DRAC — Data resolution and analytics center.
  • KYC Engine — Identity verification and compliance tool.
  • Bundles & APIs — Unified access, billing, and API management.

Explore how each product works, how to integrate with them, and best practices for deploying them in your organization.

docs.title: 🚀 Getting Started
docs.text:
New to Pluggedspace? Start here:

  • Platform Architecture
  • Authentication & API Keys
  • Using the Portal

docs.title: 📦 Product Documentation
docs.text:
• Monica – Customer Service AI
  • DRAC – Dispute & Data Resolution
  • KYC Engine – Compliance Layer
  • Bundles, Plans & Billing

docs.title: 📘 Resources
docs.text:
• FAQs
  • Glossary
  • Support & Contact

For additional help or questions, visit pluggedspace.org or contact us at support@pluggedspace.org.

Build smart. Build unified. Build with Pluggedspace.

docs.title: 🛠️ Support & Contact
docs.text: Need help with Pluggedspace products or integrations? We’re here for you. Whether you're an end user, a developer, or an agency partner, this page will guide you to the right support channels.

docs.title: 📬 Contact Us
docs.text:
You can reach out to our support team through the following channels:

  • Email: support@pluggedspace.org
  • Live Chat: Available via the Pluggedspace Portal during business hours (Mon–Fri, 9am–6pm WAT)
  • Twitter/X: @pluggedspace
  • GitHub Issues: For technical bugs or documentation issues, use our GitHub issues page

docs.title: 🔧 Troubleshooting Guide
docs.text:
Before contacting support, you might want to:

  1. Check the relevant product documentation.
  2. Visit our FAQs.
  3. Review your API key, tenant configuration, or usage logs from the portal.

docs.title: 🧠 Community & Feedback
docs.text:
We're constantly improving. Help us by sharing your experience:

  • Feature suggestions: Submit Feedback
  • Join our Discord (coming soon!)
  • Report bugs on GitHub

docs.title: 📄 Service-Level Commitments
docs.text:
We aim to respond to all inquiries within:

  • General inquiries: 24–48 business hours
  • API downtime / service outage: Within 2 hours
  • Billing issues: Within 1 business day

Your success is our priority — we’re committed to helping you build and scale with confidence.

If you’re an enterprise client or partner with dedicated support, please contact your account manager directly or use your priority support channel.

docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Job Autobot Documentation
docs.text: Job Autobot is an AI-powered job search assistant available on Telegram that helps job seekers find opportunities, build professional CVs, and navigate their career development.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
1. Overview
  2. Getting Started
  3. Commands Reference
  4. Features
  5. For Developers
  6. Pricing & Limits
  7. Support
  8. FAQ

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Job Autobot leverages AI to streamline the job search process by providing:

  • Smart Job Search: Find relevant opportunities using natural language queries
  • CV Building: Create and optimize professional resumes
  • Career Guidance: Get personalized career path recommendations
  • Application Tools: Generate cover letters and improve your CV
  • Job Alerts: Receive notifications for new matching positions

Target Audience: Job seekers at all career levels, from entry-level to experienced professionals.

docs.title: Accessing Job Autobot
docs.text:
1. Open Telegram

  2. Search for @jobautobot or visit: t.me/jobautobot

  3. Start Chatting

  4. Send /start to begin

  5. Use available commands to explore features

  6. Free vs Premium

  7. Free users get 10 job searches per month
  8. Upgrade to premium for unlimited access and advanced features

docs.title: /findjobs [keywords] [location] [type]
docs.text:
Searches for jobs across multiple platforms.

Parameters: - keywords (required): Job title, skills, or company names - location (optional): City, country, or "remote" - type (optional): full-time, part-time, contract, internship

Examples:


/findjobs python developer
/findjobs data scientist london
/findjobs frontend developer remote full-time
/findjobs marketing manager new york

docs.title: /quota
docs.text:
Shows your remaining job searches for the current month.

Free Users: 10 searches per month Premium Users: Unlimited searches

docs.title: /history
docs.text: Displays your saved jobs and search history.

docs.title: /build_cv
docs.text:
Starts an interactive CV creation wizard with the following sections: - Personal information - Work experience (multiple positions) - Education history - Skills and competencies - Projects and portfolio - Certifications and awards - References

The bot guides you through each section step by step.

docs.title: /view_cv
docs.text: Displays your current CV in a formatted, readable layout.

docs.title: /cv_review
docs.text: Provides AI-powered analysis of your CV with suggestions for: - Formatting improvements - Content optimization - Keyword enhancement for ATS systems - Section organization

docs.title: /setalert
docs.text:
Creates personalized job alerts based on your criteria: - Job titles and keywords - Locations (or remote) - Salary ranges - Experience levels - Company types

Examples of alert criteria: - "Senior software engineer positions in Berlin" - "Remote marketing jobs paying $80k+" - "Entry-level data analyst roles"

docs.title: /myalerts
docs.text: Manages your active job alerts: - View all active alerts - Edit alert criteria - Delete alerts - Pause/resume alerts

docs.title: /careerpath [current_role]
docs.text:
Explores career progression options and potential growth paths.

Examples:


/careerpath software developer
/careerpath marketing coordinator
/careerpath data analyst

Provides: - Next-level positions - Required skills and experience - Salary progression data - Alternative career paths

docs.title: /practice
docs.text: Interactive interview preparation with: - Common behavioral questions - Technical questions by field - STAR method guidance - Sample answers and feedback

docs.title: /upskill
docs.text: Generates personalized learning recommendations: - Skill gaps analysis - Online course suggestions - Reading materials - Project ideas - Certification paths

docs.title: /coverletter Job Title | Company
docs.text:
Generates tailored cover letters based on: - Specific job title and company - Your CV information - Industry standards and best practices - Company research and culture fit

Format: /coverletter [Job Title] | [Company Name]

Examples:


/coverletter Software Engineer | Google
/coverletter Marketing Manager| Apple
/coverletter Data Scientist| Remote Company

Features: - Customized to job requirements - Highlights relevant experience - Professional tone and structure - Editable template output

docs.title: /subscribe
docs.text:
Shows premium plan options and upgrade process.

Premium Benefits: - Unlimited job searches (vs. 10/month free) - Up to 5 active job alerts (vs. 1 free) - Advanced CV templates and analytics - Priority support - Full search results access - Enhanced career insights

docs.title: /start
docs.text: Initializes the bot and displays welcome message with overview.

docs.title: /help
docs.text: Lists all available commands with brief descriptions.

docs.title: Smart Job Search
docs.text:
• Natural Language Processing: Understands complex queries like "senior python jobs in tech startups"
  • Multi-platform Aggregation: Searches across major job boards and company career pages
  • Advanced Filtering: Location, salary, experience level, company size, and more
  • Relevance Scoring: AI-powered matching based on your profile and preferences

docs.title: Professional CV Builder
docs.text:
• Guided Creation: Step-by-step process for each CV section
  • Industry Templates: Field-specific formats (tech, marketing, healthcare, etc.)
  • ATS Optimization: Ensures compatibility with applicant tracking systems
  • Export Options: Multiple format support

docs.title: Intelligent Matching
docs.text:
• Profile-based Recommendations: Suggests jobs matching your skills and experience
  • Company Culture Fit: Considers work environment preferences
  • Growth Opportunities: Identifies roles with career advancement potential

docs.title: Career Analytics
docs.text:
• Search Tracking: Monitors your job search activity and patterns
  • Skill Gap Analysis: Identifies areas for professional development
  • Market Insights: Provides industry trends and salary data

docs.title: Technical Architecture
docs.text:
While Job Autobot is currently Telegram-only, the system is built on:

  • Natural Language Processing: For understanding job search queries and CV content
  • Machine Learning Models: For job matching and career path recommendations
  • Data Integration: Aggregating job listings from multiple sources
  • User Profiling: Building comprehensive candidate profiles

docs.title: Future API Considerations
docs.text: Potential future endpoints may include: - Job search integration - CV parsing and analysis - Career path recommendations - Application tracking

docs.title: Integration Possibilities
docs.text:
• Career platforms
  • Educational institutions
  • Recruitment agencies
  • HR systems

docs.title: Free Plan
docs.text:
• ✅ 10 job searches per month
  • ✅ Basic CV building
  • ✅ 1 active job alert
  • ✅ Standard command access
  • ✅ Community support

docs.title: Premium Plan ($9.99/month)
docs.text:
• ✅ Unlimited job searches
  • ✅ Up to 5 active job alerts
  • ✅ Advanced CV templates and analytics
  • ✅ Priority support
  • ✅ Full search results access
  • ✅ Enhanced career insights
  • ✅ Early access to new features

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
• In-Bot Support: Use /help for command assistance
  • Email: support@pluggedspace.org
  • Documentation: docs.pluggedspace.org/models/jobautobot
  • Website: pluggedspace.org/projects/jobautobot

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
• Search Limits: Use /quota to check remaining searches
  • CV Building: Use /build_cv for step-by-step guidance
  • Job Alerts: Use /myalerts to manage notifications
  • Premium Features: Use /subscribe for upgrade information

docs.title: 🤔 How accurate are the job matches?
docs.text: Job Autobot uses advanced AI algorithms to match your profile with relevant positions, considering skills, experience, preferences, and career goals.

docs.title: 💼 Which job boards do you search?
docs.text: We aggregate from multiple sources including major job boards, company career pages, and specialized platforms to provide comprehensive results.

docs.title: 📄 Can I export my CV?
docs.text: Yes, the CV builder allows export in multiple formats suitable for different applications.

docs.title: 🔔 How often do job alerts update?
docs.text: Alerts check for new positions daily and notify you immediately when matches are found.

docs.title: 💰 Is there a free trial for premium?
docs.text: All users start with free access. Premium features are available through subscription with clear benefits outlined.

docs.title: 🔒 Is my data secure?
docs.text: Yes, we take data privacy seriously. Your personal information and CV data are encrypted and stored securely.

docs.title: 📱 Is there a mobile app?
docs.text:
Job Autobot runs entirely within Telegram, which is available on all major mobile platforms.

Last updated: January 2025 Version: 2.1 For the latest updates, visit our documentation site.

docs.title: Welcome to match-bot Documentation
docs.text: For full API reference visit m.pluggedspace.org.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
1. Requesting an API Key
  2. Authentication
  3. Telegram Bot Usage
  4. API Endpoints
  5. GET /api/
  6. POST /api/retrain/
  7. GET /api/dashboard/overview/
  8. GET /api/dashboard/confidence/
  9. GET /api/predictions/latest/
  10. GET /api/dashboard/compare_versions/
  11. GET /dashboard/predictions/
  12. Rate Limits
  13. Support

docs.title: Requesting an API Key
docs.text:
To use the match-bot API:

  1. Apply Online
  2. Visit: https://m.pluggedspace.org/apply

  3. Fill out the application form with:

    • Name / Organization
    • Intended usage (project or integration)
    • Contact email

  4. Email Request

  5. Send to: access@pluggedspace.org
  6. Subject: API Access Request
  7. Body: Include your details and intended usage.

Once approved, you will receive: - API Key (unique to your account) - Usage limits - API documentation link

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
All API requests must include your API key:

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

docs.title: Telegram Bot Usage
docs.text:
Find the bot on Telegram: @matchoutcomebot

Commands: - /predict Arsenal vs Manchester United — Predicts the outcome of a specific match - /nextmatch — Shows the next scheduled match with prediction - /help — Lists all available commands

docs.title: GET /api/
docs.text:
Returns available endpoints and service info.

Example:

curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" https://api.m.pluggedspace.org/api/

docs.title: POST /api/retrain/
docs.text:
Triggers a model retrain. Admin access only.

Example:

curl -X POST -H "Authorization: Bearer ADMIN_API_KEY" \
https://api.m.pluggedspace.org/api/retrain/

docs.title: GET /api/dashboard/overview/
docs.text:
Returns aggregated prediction stats.

Example Response:

{
  "total_predictions": 125,
  "accuracy": 0.82,
  "average_confidence": 0.74
}

docs.title: GET /api/dashboard/confidence/
docs.text:
Returns prediction confidence distribution.

Example Response:

{
  "high_confidence": 58,
  "medium_confidence": 47,
  "low_confidence": 20
}

docs.title: GET /api/predictions/latest/
docs.text:
Returns the most recent match predictions.

Example:

curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
https://api.m.pluggedspace.org/api/predictions/latest/

Example Response:

[
  {
    "match_id": 987,
    "home_team": "Arsenal",
    "away_team": "Manchester United",
    "predicted_outcome": "Home Win",
    "predicted_goal_diff": 1.4,
    "confidence": 0.81
  }
]

docs.title: GET /api/dashboard/compare_versions/
docs.text:
Compares prediction accuracy between model versions.

Example Response:

{
  "version_1": { "accuracy": 0.78 },
  "version_2": { "accuracy": 0.82 }
}

docs.title: GET /dashboard/predictions/
docs.text:
Returns prediction data for dashboard visualization.

Example Response:

[
  {
    "match": "Liverpool vs Chelsea",
    "outcome": "Draw",
    "confidence": 0.66
  },
  {
    "match": "Barcelona vs Real Madrid",
    "outcome": "Away Win",
    "confidence": 0.72
  }
]

docs.title: Rate Limits
docs.text: Plan Requests/day Notes Free 50 Basic access Pro 5,000 Higher limits & priority Enterprise Custom Dedicated support

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
• Email: support@pluggedspace.org
  • Telegram: @MatchOutcomeBot
  • Documentation: https://docs.pluggedspace.org/models/match
